House Bill/Resolution NO. HB00027
FULL TITLE : AN ACT AMENDING SECTIONS 3-A AND 4 OF THE PRESIDENTIAL DECREE NO. 1865 TO INCREASE THE PENALTIES FOR PROHIBITED ACTS SUCH AS ADULTERATION OF PETROLEUM PRODUCTS WHICH IS INIMICAL TO PUBLIC INTEREST
SHORT TITLE : Oil Anti-adulteration Act Of 2016
ABSTRACT : Increases the penalties for the prohibitive acts of adulteration of furnished petroleum products, or possession of adulterated finished petroleum products for the purpose of sale, distribution, transportation, exchange or barter.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : UMALI, REYNALDO V.
DATE FILED : 2016-06-30
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
NATURE : Economic
CO-AUTHORS (Journal Entries) :
1. Primicias-Agabas (014 2016-08-23)
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Referred to Stakeholders on 2016-08-11
      2. Deliberated upon by the Mother Committee on 2017-03-14
      3. Referred to the Technical Working Group (TWG) on 2017-10-19
          -The TWG deferred further deliberation on the measure pending submissions by the DOE on the definition of “marketer” and of the Atin To’ Development Services on the definition and specification of Light Cycle Oil (LCO). The TWG is still awaiting for the submission of the said inputs.
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON ENERGY ON 2016-07-26
